pageProps.body:
Pre Semester

PredMod (Private) MSE

Pre-Semster

Cumulative Distribution Function

Cumulative Distribution Function is defined as follows: F(x)=P(X≤x)F(x) = P(X \le x)F(x)=P(X≤x) where XXX is the set of all possible values of the random variable and xxx is the value of the random variable at which the CDF is to be evaluated. This is needed to get a range of values e.g. F(X∈(a,b])=P(a<X≤b)F(X \in (a,b]) = P(a < X \le b)F(X∈(a,b])=P(a<X≤b) which is defined as F(b)−F(a)F(b) - F(a)F(b)−F(a). Important as well. The derivative F′(x)F'(x)F′(x) is always 0 or bigger

probability density Function

The probability density Function is defined as f(x)=F′(x)f(x) = F'(x)f(x)=F′(x) which is the derivative of the CDF. The PDF must always be zero or positive - as the CDF is always monotonically increasing. P(a<X≤b)=F(b)−F(a)=∫abf(x)dxP(a < X \le b) = F(b) - F(a) = \int_a^b f(x)dxP(a<X≤b)=F(b)−F(a)=∫ab​f(x)dx

expected value

The expected value E(X)E(X)E(X) and the standard deviation σX\sigma_XσX​ have the same meaining in the discrete and the continuous case. E(X)=∫−∞∞xf(x)dxE(X) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} x f(x) dxE(X)=∫−∞∞​xf(x)dx whereas xxx is the outcome and f(x)dxf(x) dxf(x)dx is the probability of the outcome.

variance

The variance V(X)V(X)V(X) is defined as V(X)=E(X2)−E(X)2V(X) = E(X^2) - E(X)^2V(X)=E(X2)−E(X)2

quantiles

The quantiles are defined as q(a)=182.5q(a) = 182.5q(a)=182.5 which means that 75% of the values are smaller than q(a)q(a)q(a) and 25% are larger than q(a)q(a)q(a).

important continous distributions

Uniform Distribution

The uniform distribution is defined as follows:

f(x)={1b−aifa≤x≤b0elsef(x) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} \frac{1}{b-a} & if a \le x \le b \\ 0 & else \end{array} \right.f(x)={b−a1​0​ifa≤x≤belse​

dunif(x = 5, min = 1, max = 10) for the density of the uniform distribution at x=5x = 5x=5 from 111 to 101010. To get the probability of P(1≤X≤5)P(1 \le X \le 5)P(1≤X≤5) use punif(q = 5, min = 1, max = 10). To generate random variables use the following code snippet: runif(n = 5, min = 1, max = 10)

Exponential Distribution

The exponential distribution is defined as follows: exp(x)=exexp(x) = e^xexp(x)=ex

f(x)={λ∗exp(−λx)ifx≥00otherwisef(x) = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} \lambda * exp(-\lambda x) & if x \geq 0 \\ 0 & otherwise \end{array} \right.f(x)={λ∗exp(−λx)0​ifx≥0otherwise​

where we write X∼Exp(λ)X \sim Exp(\lambda)X∼Exp(λ) Assuming X∼Exp(3)X \sim Exp(3)X∼Exp(3) for P(0≤X≤4)P(0 \le X \le 4)P(0≤X≤4) with R it is calculated as follows pexp(4, rate = 3)

Poisson and Exponential Distribution

These two distributions are related. If the time elapsed between two failures of a system follows Exp(λ\lambdaλ), then the number of failures during the period t follows Poisson(λ∗t\lambda * tλ∗t). P(T>t)=P(T≤t)=P(no decay in[0,t])=(λt)0e−λt0!=e−λtP(T > t) = P(T \le t) = P(\text{no decay in} [0,t]) = \frac{(\lambda t)^0 e^{-\lambda t}}{0!} = e^{-\lambda t}P(T>t)=P(T≤t)=P(no decay in[0,t])=0!(λt)0e−λt​=e−λt

Normal distribution

This is the most important distribution: f(x)=1σ2πexp(−(x−y)22σ2)f(x) = \frac{1}{\sigma \sqrt{2 \pi}} exp(-\frac{(x - y)^2}{2 \sigma^2 })f(x)=σ2π​1​exp(−2σ2(x−y)2​) the cumulative distirbution function cannot be explicitly expressed by formulas and must be calculated with software. IQ Example: X∼N(100,152)X \sim \mathcal{N}(100, 15^2)X∼N(100,152) where 15 is the standard deviation. Use R to get the value 1 - pnorm(130, mean = 100, sd = 15) = 0.022 - therefore 2% is highly gifted.

CDF (Private) PDF (Private) Expected Value (Private) Variance (Private) Quantiles (Private)

noteIndex.title: Root
noteIndex.body:
# Welcome to Dendron

This is the root of your dendron vault. If you decide to publish your entire vault, this will be your landing page. You are free to customize any part of this page except the frontmatter on top.

## Lookup

This section contains useful links to related resources.

- [Getting Started Guide](https://link.dendron.so/6b25)
- [Discord](https://link.dendron.so/6b23)
- [Home Page](https://wiki.dendron.so/)
- [Github](https://link.dendron.so/6b24)
- [Developer Docs](https://docs.dendron.so/)
